alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 11:23AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt any available high mountain snowpack, allowing for continued elevated river flows. For the Lamoille Creek...including Lamoille...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.0 feet, This is monitoring stage. Visitors to the lamoille canyon and the powerhouse picnic area need to use extreme caution around lamoille creek and other creeks in the ruby mountains. Pets, children, and even adults can be swept away in the strong current. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:40 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.0 feet. - Flood stage is 4.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
